page.title: 20How we did this survey
page.content: The survey was a shared activity between two Primary Schools. Samuel Barlow being the larger of the two schools we undertook to cover 2/3rds of the land cover and 3/4 of the text. Within our school we did our survey in small groups. Typically a teacher and a group of about 6 children went out. The teacher being relieved of their normal teaching load by usually the headteacher taking the rest of the class. This was further complicated by the teachers in the National Union of Teachers and the National Association of Schoolmasters/mistresses being on industrial action and not covering for absent colleagues as usual or working through their lunchbreak. The children wrote most of the text but it had to be edited by teachers. We thoroughly enjoyed the process.
